title: Textile, "Marea Panel", 2007
medium:
Medium: nylon, copper
Technique: plain weave with paired warps
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 304.8 x 98.4 cm (10 ft. x 38 3/4 in.)
creditline: Gift of Cristina Grajales Inc. and Jorge Lizarazo for Hechizoo
description: Handwoven black nylon and copper panel.
justification: In Marea (2007), Jorge Lizarazo employs black nylon and copper to make a coal-black blanket that shimmers and reflects the surrounding light. Intended as a decorative panel or window curtain Marea, not unlike many other textiles by Hechizoo, is meant to interact with the interior spaces, not overpower them. This approach to textiles reflects the spirit of Bauhaus master weavers such as Anni Albers and Gunta Stolzl. Marea serves as an excellent example of contemporary Columbian textiles, as well as an interesting comparison with historical examples in the collection.
